alert.note: Alert for Platte (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 28 at 7:28PM CDT until April 28 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Platte County in northeastern Nebraska... * Until 815 PM CDT. * At 727 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Platte Center, or 11 miles northwest of Columbus, and is nearly stationary. This storm has a history of producing large hail. HAZARD...Half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of Platte County, including the following locations... Lake North Babcock Campground, Tarnov, Central Community College, Cornlea, College View Trailer Park, Humphrey, Circle H Trailer Park and Shell Creek Elementary School. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
